lines.text: We would like for you to give us a room and a bath.
I can give you the room, but you'll have to take the bath yourself.
Where is Mr. Hardy? I haven't seen him in the past three weeks.
Oh, he's awful sick.
Is that a fact?
Hoot, ma'am. You know the day he fell in the water he got an awful cold, and it turned into pneumatics.
Is he very sick?
You're darn hootin' he's sick! You know the only thing he can keep on his stomach is a hot water bottle.
My, my, what a predicament!
Yeah! I think he's got that too.
Good morning Mr. Miggs.
Well, what are you doing? You're all dressed up?
Well, we're in the army! How do we look.
Ha-ha-ha-ha. God save the King!
All the way from America on a cattle boat...
[shakes bagpipes]
for *this*.

[a gunshot is heard behind a screen]
Remove the body.

[the screen is removed. Stan has his eyes closed and a pistol pointed over his head]
What happened?
I missed myself.
[cries]

[after hearing that Sandy MacLaurel killed himself at the sight of his newborn son]
That must have been an ugly kid.
Sandy MacLaurel was *your father*.
Well, ain't she the 'igh and mighty one, denying a little girl a bit o' sparking!
Is she gone?
Yes, thank goodness. Oh, I thought for a minute the game was up. She did not tell me off.
I heard her. I was a wee bit afraid myself. So, it's a wonder you didn't hear my knees knocking.
Well, cast me over the 'urdles. I'll get even with you if it's the last thing I do!
Say Ollie, what was that the General was trying to tell us that he didn't know himself? You know, about the mysteries of something?
I don't know. Ask old Leatherpuss.
Who?
Leatherpuss!
Sgt. Leatherpuss?
Are you speaking to me?
Yes sir.
Who informed you my name was Leatherpuss?

[Pointing to Ollie]
He did.
Well, my name is Sgt Finlayson, to you! From now on!

[Elderly Scottish lady]
Oh, by the way, Mr. Miggs?
Yes, Mrs. Bunts?
The next time you drop down to Glasgow, you must come up and see me sometime.
Thank you.

[to Ollie]
That's Mae West.
Well, here's another nice mess you've gotten me into.
What do you think we better do, Ollie?
I expected that. Every time you get us into a mess, you come to me, expecting me to get us out of it.
Well, it wasn't my fault.

What do you mean it wasn't your fault? If you hadn't been so money mad, we wouldn't be here! There we were, comfortably in jail, with one more week to serve. And you had to talk me into breaking out. Just to come on this wild goose chase of yours!
Well, I guess we'll have to stow our way back home again. Go back to the jail and tell the warden we're sorry for all the trouble we've put him to and maybe we'll get our old cell back.
That's a very, very, very good idea! Just as soon as my pants are dry, we'll formulate - our plans.
Where have you been?
The landlady gave me this. It's the bill for three weeks rent.
There are more important things than this. Did you get me any pants?
No, but, I got something to eat.
How are you going to cook it?
I never thought of that.
No, you wouldn't! Once again, I have to come to your rescue and be the Mother of Invention! Oh!
What you going to do?
I'm going to cook the fish, over the candle.
I've got an idea that's better than your Mother's invention.
Oh! This has gone far enough! Rent or no rent, get out of my house! You-you foreigners!

[Referring to Ollie]
He can't go out, he hasn't got any pants.
Come on! Pack up your things and get out!
Ha-ha-ha-ha - - - Ha!
What are you laughing at?
Why shouldn't I laugh? Here am I, Oliver Norvell Hardy. A man without a home. A man without a country. A man without any pants!

[Walking down a snowy street in kilts]
Ollie?
What?
Do you feel a draft?
Leatherpuss! I'll remember that!
Gee, I'm dumb today.
Today?

[to Stan]
Well, you fixed me up pretty, didn't you!

Oh, but Greg, you are a simpleton. This is all so plain to me. Just a case of puppy love in Scotland. You know, promises of undying affection and all that sort of thing. Then, Lorna inherited this money and the boy thought he might as well be in on it. Most people would do anything for 200,000 pounds.
Hey, come here! I thought I told you to clean this place up.

[Pointing to Ollie]
Well, he told me not to pay any attention to what you had said.
Doh! Who's running this army? You or me!
[Ollie and Stan point to Finlayson]
Right! Now get to work! And don't let me see a speck when I get back! Leatherpuss, hmm!
What are walking like that for?

[Walking bowlegged]
Well the horse didn't fit me.
There's no escape! Take those.

[Stan and Ollie pick up two pistols]
What are these for?
You are to use those to blow your brains out!

[Crying]
Oh, I never blew my brains out before.
